intro: Erigeron polymorphus subsp. montenegrinus, commonly known as the Montenegro Fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region, particularly Montenegro. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and is known for its delicate white to pale blue flowers. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
